section_title: Autologous Chondrocyte Implantation (Evidence: pg no: 22, L974)
names: Autologous chondrocyte implantation (Evidence: pg no: 22, L976)
description: Autologous chondrocyte implantation to treat cartilaginous defects of the knee/patella (Evidence: pg no: 22, L976-L992)
scope: Treatment of knee and patellar cartilage defects (Evidence: pg no: 22, L974-L992)

documentation: Primary chondral defect is present or prior surgical procedure failed to correct defect (Evidence: pg no: 22, L979)
Size of cartilage defect is greater than or equal to 1.5 cm2 in total area, as documented by MRI or arthroscopy (Evidence: pg no: 22, L980-L981)
Condition involves focal, full thickness, grade III or IV isolated unipolar defect of knee involving weight bearing surface (Evidence: pg no: 22, L982-L984)
Defect involves only cartilage and not subchondral bone (with exception for OCD) (Evidence: pg no: 22, L985-L988)
Documented minimal to absent degenerative changes in surrounding articular cartilage (Evidence: pg no: 22, L989-L990)
Normal knee biomechanics or alignment and stability achieved concurrently (Evidence: pg no: 22, L991-L992)

exclusions: Known allergy to gentamicin or other aminoglycosides (Evidence: pg no: 22, L995)
Known sensitivity to porcine or bovine cultures (Evidence: pg no: 22, L996)
Severe osteoarthritis of knee (Kellgren-Lawrence grade 3 or 4) (Evidence: pg no: 22, L997)
Inflammatory arthritis, inflammatory joint disease, or uncorrected congenital blood coagulation disorders (Evidence: pg no: 22, L998)
Knee surgery within previous 6 months (except surgery to procure biopsy or concomitant procedure) (Evidence: pg no: 22, L999-L1000)
Inability to cooperate with physician-prescribed post-surgical rehabilitation program (Evidence: pg no: 22, L1001)

codes.description: Autologous chondrocyte implantation, knee (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1056)
Autologous cultured chondrocytes, implant (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1066)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical for harvesting of cartilage (chondrocyte cells) (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1067)

notes: Defects greater than 7 cm2 may require more than one vial (Evidence: pg no: 22, L981)
